gen1_pokemon_1.png.name: Abra
gen1_pokemon_1.png.description: Abra uses its psychic powers to teleport away from danger while asleep.

gen1_pokemon_2.png.name: Bulbasaur
gen1_pokemon_2.png.description: Bulbasaur's bulb absorbs sunlight to grow, storing energy for evolution.

gen1_pokemon_3.png.name: Caterpie
gen1_pokemon_3.png.description: Caterpie releases a horrible stench from its antennae to repel predators.

gen1_pokemon_4.png.name: Charmander
gen1_pokemon_4.png.description: Charmander's tail flame burns brighter when it is excited or angry.

gen1_pokemon_5.png.name: Clefairy
gen1_pokemon_5.png.description: Clefairy dances under the moonlight, gathering energy from the stars.

gen1_pokemon_6.png.name: Diglett
gen1_pokemon_6.png.description: Diglett burrows through the earth, loosening soil for farmers.

gen1_pokemon_7.png.name: Ditto
gen1_pokemon_7.png.description: Ditto can transform into any Pokémon it sees, copying their abilities.

gen1_pokemon_8.png.name: Dratini
gen1_pokemon_8.png.description: Dratini is a rare Pokémon that sheds its skin as it grows.

gen1_pokemon_9.png.name: Ekans
gen1_pokemon_9.png.description: Ekans silently slithers through grass, attacking with its deadly bite.

gen1_pokemon_10.png.name: Gastly
gen1_pokemon_10.png.description: Gastly is a gaseous Pokémon that can envelop and suffocate foes.

gen1_pokemon_11.png.name: Growlithe
gen1_pokemon_11.png.description: Growlithe is loyal and protective, often seen guarding its territory.

gen1_pokemon_12.png.name: Horsea
gen1_pokemon_12.png.description: Horsea shoots ink to escape predators and uses its fins to swim gracefully.

gen1_pokemon_13.png.name: Jigglypuff
gen1_pokemon_13.png.description: Jigglypuff's song can lull even the most stubborn Pokémon to sleep.

gen1_pokemon_14.png.name: Machop
gen1_pokemon_14.png.description: Machop builds strength by lifting large rocks and practicing its punches.

gen1_pokemon_15.png.name: Magnemite
gen1_pokemon_15.png.description: Magnemite uses magnetic fields to float and disrupt electronic devices.

gen1_pokemon_16.png.name: Meowth
gen1_pokemon_16.png.description: Meowth loves shiny objects and often collects coins in its spare time.

gen1_pokemon_17.png.name: Mew
gen1_pokemon_17.png.description: Mew is said to contain the DNA of every Pokémon, making it incredibly versatile.

gen1_pokemon_18.png.name: Oddish
gen1_pokemon_18.png.description: Oddish buries itself during the day and absorbs moonlight at night.

gen1_pokemon_19.png.name: Parasect
gen1_pokemon_19.png.description: Parasect controls its host's body with the mushroom on its back.

gen1_pokemon_20.png.name: Pidgey
gen1_pokemon_20.png.description: Pidgey flaps its wings with great speed, kicking up dust to escape predators.

gen1_pokemon_21.png.name: Pikachu
gen1_pokemon_21.png.description: Pikachu stores electricity in its cheeks, ready to release powerful shocks.

gen1_pokemon_22.png.name: Poliwag
gen1_pokemon_22.png.description: Poliwag's thin, transparent skin shows its spiral innards.

gen1_pokemon_23.png.name: Ponyta
gen1_pokemon_23.png.description: Ponyta's mane burns hotter as it gains confidence in battle.

gen1_pokemon_24.png.name: Psyduck
gen1_pokemon_24.png.description: Psyduck often suffers from headaches, which unleash its psychic powers.

gen1_pokemon_25.png.name: Rattata
gen1_pokemon_25.png.description: Rattata gnaws on anything in its path to keep its teeth sharp.

gen1_pokemon_26.png.name: Sandshrew
gen1_pokemon_26.png.description: Sandshrew curls into a ball to defend itself from attackers.

gen1_pokemon_27.png.name: Seel
gen1_pokemon_27.png.description: Seel swims gracefully and uses its horn to break through ice.

gen1_pokemon_28.png.name: Shellder
gen1_pokemon_28.png.description: Shellder's shell is incredibly hard, providing excellent defense.

gen1_pokemon_29.png.name: Slowpoke
gen1_pokemon_29.png.description: Slowpoke takes life at its own pace, fishing with its tail.

gen1_pokemon_30.png.name: Squirtle
gen1_pokemon_30.png.description: Squirtle withdraws into its shell for protection and sprays water at enemies.

gen1_pokemon_31.png.name: Staryu
gen1_pokemon_31.png.description: Staryu regenerates its body from its core when damaged.

gen1_pokemon_32.png.name: Voltorb
gen1_pokemon_32.png.description: Voltorb resembles a Poké Ball and explodes when disturbed.

gen1_pokemon_33.png.name: Vulpix
gen1_pokemon_33.png.description: Vulpix's six tails grow hotter and more beautiful as it matures.

gen1_pokemon_34.png.name: Weedle
gen1_pokemon_34.png.description: Weedle's sharp stinger is coated with a venom that deters predators.

gen1_pokemon_35.png.name: Weepinbell
gen1_pokemon_35.png.description: Weepinbell uses its pitcher-like body to trap and digest prey.

gen1_pokemon_36.png.name: Zubat
gen1_pokemon_36.png.description: Zubat flits through caves, using echolocation to navigate in darkness.
